div.p: Greetings. Dear son, I have nothing to write at the moment. I am expecting your letter along with the promised booklet on the types of divination. We are all quite well. Take care of the enclosed items.

Especially greet Mr. Christoph Froschauer; pray that he does not take it badly that I am not writing now, for I am overwhelmed and exhausted by the multitude of tasks. Live well and farewell. Greet Mr. Garnier, the head of the French church. Everyone here sends their regards to you.
Zurich, March 22. Spend your time well. Kindly greet the master and mistress.
To my dear son Heinrich Bullinger with Mr. Johann Burckhardt, Englishman, in Strasbourg.
